text:
Hi everyone,
I am trying to use `/crm/v3/objects/{object}/search` api to search for contacts by emails, the api works fine for contacts with one email, but it canâ€™t find contacts that have more than 1 email.
Do anyone have any suggestions? Thanks a lot :smiley:
Up <@U03MLCLS5BN>?

Hi all,
I am using ruby gem HubSpot-api-client. I want to replace api-key method with access token but for every method I am getting error that only API-KEy and oauth auth methods are supported. Can someone help here?
Not all the v1 apis have v3 endpoints some just get deprecated, the closest you're going to get is the /search api and sort by create/update timestamp
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/search>

Sorting:
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/search#sort-search-results>
FYI you will have to specify the engagement type (note, email, task, meeting, call, etc...)
Like it just wont find it if you use the secondary email for the search?
By activities do you mean engagements? Calls, emails, meetings, notes, tasks?
Does your auth look like this:
```api_client = HubSpot::Client.new(access_token: 'YOUR_ACCESS_TOKEN')```

Notice the difference between the access token auth and api_key auth:
```api_client = HubSpot::Client.new(api_key: 'YOUR_HAPIKEY')```

Hi <@UN72NHVRA>, I came across this old thread as I have a similar issue. We are tying to test a custom third party app with calling extension sdk, but it is not working without activating the calling feature. Do you confirm that to use that feature you still need to have a paid user? Or did it change something? (I hope so!) Thanks

Hello, why does a call to crm.schemas.core_api.create yield "Unexpected property type 'datetime', expected one of: [string, object_coordinates, json]"? The documentation states that the datetime property type is valid, including examples.
Are you using the Nodejs SDK
Python
Ah ok yeah, honestly it may be you doing something wrong but it's also very possible that it's the sdk (it's happened to me in the past) I would just use the regular api for that call
It's not the SDK issue, I've already fixed all of those.
I might not be correctly understanding what type is.
What is the difference between type and fieldType?
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/properties#property-type-and-fieldtype-values>
Hello guys. If there is any methods to get HubSpot portalId using official nodejs api client?
Just looked through the docs and I'm pretty sure there isn't one

Force them to build a project. Tell them that HubSpot is just a super powerful database that can be written to and read from. Most new developers learn HTML, JS, CSS so I would try and get them to use the CMS and build a module that combines the CRM and CMS together. This way they can get an easy win because they already know web dev, but also learn about all the things that the crm can do.
I really not super well versed in the SDK though so take that with a grain of salt
<@UFBNA9K9A>, There isn't a native method thought right?
Not in the current version. Iâ€™ll ask the team if they can add the account info APIs in the next release
Awesome, that would be helpful thanks!

Are there any known .NET C# api client packages out there, current/decent? At a glance I wasn't finding any. I'm only needing a few endpoints so far anyways. But if there's an API client out there that will cover the whole gamut and is likely to stay current (similar to the official ruby/nodejs/etc clients) that'd be awesome.
<@U01967KBSQJ> 2 years later: Did that work out for you, or did you write your own? I'm thinking that one is not as current now. Just curious. I had the same question.
Thanks guys

While trying to create a custom object I get this:
```Property values were not valid: [{\"isValid\":false,\"message\":\"2022-09-30T14:06:51.741000+00:00 was not a valid long...```
The property type is datetime. I tried sending unix timestamp, it accepts it, but shows 1970-01-20T06:22:45 instead of the proper datetime.
What is that cryptic error message and what value can I specify so it accepts it correctly?
datetime properties take millisecond timestamps
so that should work,
Oh sorry EPOC Milliseconds: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C019VT42R8X/p1654587868774979>
Thanks, that worked! Why is the documentation lacking in this information?
Probably because HubSpot literally has hundreds of apis spanning internal and external
It's hard to keep up with everything
Sometimes things slip through the cracks
I had to patch the python SDK, will they accept a PR? it's for a different issue.
Oh yeah for sure, that SDK is very community driven
great, thanks.
For sure

CC <@U03MLCLS5BN> can you see if we can do anything about the documentation on <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/properties#property-type-and-fieldtype-values|this> page, it should probably mention that the datetime and date properties only accept EPOC Millisecond timestamps?
This has been reported internally :slightly_smiling_face: apologies for the frustration! Weâ€™ll work on getting this doc updated.
Hi team, using the documentation to get custom objects from here <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/crm-custom-objects>, the result was: {"results":[]}
Are you positive that you have objects for that custom object type?
